intro: Coccoloba praecox, commonly known as the early coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in moist, well-drained soils. Coccoloba praecox is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage.
